meanings.definition: In terms of the study of rocks and their physical characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The geologist made a lithologically detailed map of the area.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range was lithologically diverse, with various rock types.
meanings.sent3: The rock seemed to lithologically whisper its ancient secrets to the curious explorer.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a lithologically solid fortress, impervious to doubt.
meanings.sent5: The landscape was lithologically painted with layers of history, waiting to be read.

meanings.definition: In a manner related to the composition and structure of rocks.
meanings.sent1: The river eroded the cliff lithologically over time.
meanings.sent2: The layers of sediment settled lithologically, forming distinct patterns.
meanings.sent3: The music echoed lithologically through the canyon, creating a natural amphitheater.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed lithologically, each sentence a solid rock in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The artist sculpted lithologically, chiseling away at the stone with precision.
